title: TCS, Infosys, HCLTech rise up to 4%. Why IT stocks are rising today?
text:
TCS, Infosys, HCLTech rise up to 4%. Why IT stocks are rising today?
All the sectoral indices were in red but the IT sectoral index stood tall amid the bearish sentiment in the market and was the reason behind Sensex and Nifty opening higher today.
In Short
- IT sector outperforms others in volatile trading day
- Nifty IT up 2.16%, while Nifty Media fell nearly 3%
- Market sees stock-specific action as results season begins
Benchmark stock market indices settled lower after opening higher on Friday, reflecting high volatility in the market, with Sensex and Nifty falling nearly 0.5%.
The S&P BSE Sensex fell 284.92 points to 77,335.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 106.30 points to 23,420.20 as of 10:25 AM.
[All the sectoral indices were in red ](https://www.indiatoday.in/business/story/market-opening-bell-sensex-nifty-open-higher-as-tcs-leads-it-rally-with-5-percent-jump-good-q3-results-2662657-2025-01-10)but the IT sectoral index stood tall amid the bearish sentiment in the market and was the reason behind Sensex and Nifty opening higher today.
The early upward market momentum was driven by IT stocks led by TCS which surged close to 5% on the back of strong Q3 results for FY25 which the firm announced after market hours on Thursday.
[Strong Q3 results from TCS ](https://www.indiatoday.in/business/story/tcs-q3-results-profit-rises-12-to-rs-12380-crore-announces-special-dividend-2662274-2025-01-09)buoyed the IT sector stocks, helping it remain in green when all the sectoral indices struggled in early trade.
India’s largest IT services firm, TCS, reported a 12% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit for the December quarter, reaching Rs 12,380 crore, in line with market expectations. TCS’s revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 63,973 crore, marking a 5.6% YoY increase (4.5% in constant currency).
Nifty IT was up 2.16% as of 10:30 AM while other indices fell. Nifty Media took the biggest brunt falling close to 3%.
"Since the results season has started the market will witness lots of stock-specific action in response to the results. Results of TCS indicate that the IT sector will continue to remain resilient," said Dr V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services.
In a strong showing by the IT sector, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) led the pack with a substantial gain of 4.40%, followed by Larsen & Toubro Infotech (LTI Mindtree) which rose 3.50%.
Tech Mahindra posted a healthy increase of 2.34%, while Wipro advanced by 1.97%. Persistent Systems gained 1.58%, and Mphasis climbed 1.31%.
Infosys showed positive momentum with a 1.13% increase, while HCL Technologies rounded out the gains with a 0.77% rise. The overall Nifty IT index reflected this robust performance, moving up by 2.08%.
Most of the other broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility continued to rise during the session.
